instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00431: What is 820-00431? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00034: What is 820-00034? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3478: What is 820-3478? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: missing component. imac 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-002.
threads.message:
I have a motherboard (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-002)  that has a missing resistor. I would like to know the value of that resistance. I can't find that information anywhere. The resistor is connected to the <CHIP>ISL6372</CHIP> pin 6 chip.
I'm going to post the photo of the board with the missing resistor.
Can someone help me please?

threads.title: missing component. imac 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-002.
threads.message:
No schematic/boardview for this board.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> may be the closest available.
Unfortunately, CPU power supply is not built with <CHIP>ISL6372</CHIP> in this case.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> uses <CHIP>ISL6372</CHIP>.
In this case, there is 2.67K resistor connected; 2.5-3K should be not a problem to use.
